================================================================================
Q1. Which country's president was involved in a disagreeable phone call with Trump that led to higher tariffs?
A. Switzerland
B. Mexico
C. China
D. Canada
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What did Swiss President Karin Keller-Sutter say in a social media post following the call with Trump?
A. An agreement had been reached during the conversation.
B. No agreement had been reached during the conversation.
C. The call had been pleasant.
D. The call had been unpleasant.
Correct Answer: B

Q3. According to Trade Representative Jamieson Greer, what were the latest tariffs not expected to be negotiated lower in the coming days?
A. The tariffs on steel and aluminum.
B. The tariffs on soybeans.
C. The tariffs on cars.
D. The tariffs on electronics.
Correct Answer: A

================================================================================


Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/04/heatwaves-drive-spikes-in-demand-for-air-conditioning-across-europe.html
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the International Energy Agency's report on air conditioning demand?
A. The report states that air conditioning demand is decreasing.
B. The report states that air conditioning demand is increasing due to cultural shifts and income changes.
C. The report states that air conditioning demand is increasing due to heat waves.
D. The report states that air conditioning demand is increasing due to global warming.
Correct Answer: B. The report states that air conditioning demand is increasing due to cultural shifts and income changes.

Q2. What is the European cooling market acceleration?
A. The European cooling market acceleration is due to the rise of work from home.
B. The European cooling market acceleration is due to the lower penetration of air conditioning in the northern part of Europe.
C. The European cooling market acceleration is due to the high electricity costs in Europe.
D. The European cooling market acceleration is due to the increased work loads on the region's grids.
Correct Answer: B. The European cooling market acceleration is due to the lower penetration of air conditioning in the northern part of Europe.

Q3. What is the shift in the European HVAC market?
A. The shift in the European HVAC market is due to the increased adoption of heat pumps.
B. The shift in the European HVAC market is due to the increased demand for portable AC units.
C. The shift in the European HVAC market is due to the increased demand for HVAC technologies for data centers, health care, manufacturing, and commercial real estate.
D. The shift in the European HVAC market is due to the increased demand for smarter, more efficient cooling systems.
Correct Answer: A. The shift in the European HVAC market is due to the increased adoption of heat pumps.

D. 2.5%

C. It remained the same.
D. It decreased by less than one basis point.

A. Inflation falling slightly below 2%.

C. The euro zone economy expanding by 0.1% in the second quarter.
D. The euro zone economy expanding by 0.6% in the three months to the end of March.

================================================================================
Q1. What was the ruling of the U.K.'s Court of Appeal in October last year?
A. It was unlawful for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance without getting the customer's informed consent.
B. It was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance without getting the customer's informed consent.
C. It was unlawful for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance with or without getting the customer's informed consent.
D. It was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance with or without getting the customer's informed consent.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What did Benjamin Toms, equity analyst at RBC Capital Markets, say in a research note published Monday?
A. The banks were liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, but will clear them of liability in equity and under tort.
B. The banks were liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, and will be liable in equity and under tort.
C. The banks were not liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, and will be liable in equity and under tort.
D. The banks were not liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, and will clear them of liability in equity and under tort.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What did the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) set out some of the key decisions it will make around the potential implementation of a redress scheme that would be highly complex in seeking to balance fairness for consumers and the integrity of the motor finance market?
A. It will make decisions on whether to implement a redress scheme or not.
B. It will make decisions on the amount of compensation to be paid to consumers.
C. It will make decisions on the criteria for determining whether a consumer is eligible for compensation.
D. It will make decisions on the timeline for implementing the redress scheme.
Correct Answer: C

B. No action
C. Deregulation of the industry
D. None of the above

B. Google plans to sign the code to boost Europe's economy by 1.4 trillion euros annually by 2034.
C. Google plans to sign the code to leave it up to companies to decide if they want to sign.
D. Google plans to sign the code to promote European citizens' access to advanced new AI tools and boost Europe's economy by 1.4 trillion euros annually by 2034.

A. The European Commission published a final iteration of the code of practice for general-purpose AI models.
B. The European Commission is the executive body of the EU and is responsible for enforcing the code of practice for general-purpose AI models.
C. The European Commission is responsible for leaving it up to companies to decide if they want to sign the code of practice for general-purpose AI models.
D. The European Commission is responsible for promoting European citizens' access to advanced new AI tools and boosting Europe's economy by 1.4 trillion euros annually by 2034.
Correct Answer: A

A. The goal of Google's plan to sign the code is to promote European citizens' access to advanced new AI tools.
B. The goal of Google's plan to sign the code is to boost Europe's economy by 1.4 trillion euros annually by 2034.
C. The goal of Google's plan to sign the code is to leave it up to companies to decide if they want to sign.
D. The goal of Google's plan to sign the code is to promote European citizens' access to advanced new AI tools and boost Europe's economy by 1.4 trillion euros annually by 2034.
Correct Answer: A

Q1. What Supreme Court ruling ended affirmative action in college admissions?
A. Brown v. Board of Education
B. Fisher v. University of Texas
C. Obergefell v. Hodges
D. Grutter v. Bollinger
Correct Answer: B

Q2. What is the Department of Education's directive to universities regarding data collection?
A. Collect data on the race and gender of their applicant pool, on the students admitted and of all enrolled undergraduates.
B. Collect data on the race and gender of their applicant pool, on the students admitted and of all enrolled undergraduates, but only if it is used in admissions decisions.
C. Collect data on the race and gender of their applicant pool, on the students admitted and of all enrolled undergraduates, but only if it is not used in admissions decisions.
D. Collect data on the race and gender of their applicant pool, on the students admitted and of all enrolled undergraduates, but only if it is used in a way that is legal under the Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the American Council on Education's position on collecting data on the race and gender of university applicants?
A. It is illegal under the Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action.
B. It is legal under the Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action.
C. It is not relevant to the issue of affirmative action in college admissions.
D. It is a violation of student privacy.
Correct Answer: A

B. To save more than $2.2 billion and prevent more than 5.7 million metric tons of emissions.
C. To automate real estate operations.
D. To provide hundreds of billions of dollars of savings for consumers and businesses in its current form.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the Energy Star Portfolio Manager tool used for?
A. To gauge energy performance of buildings in their portfolios and decide which ones need upgrades.
B. To maintain compliance with state and municipal regulation.
C. To connect utilities to landlords and then to dozens of state and municipal governments who rely on it to uphold their energy and climate policies, many of which include tax breaks and financial subsidies for energy savings.
D. To automate real estate operations.
Correct Answer: C

A. A complicated patchwork of compliance.
B. A fee-based system that would increase the cost to use this program.
C. A system that would disappear, taking with it the data that connects utilities to landlords and then to dozens of state and municipal governments who rely on it to uphold their energy and climate policies, many of which include tax breaks and financial subsidies for energy savings.
D. A system that would provide more savings for consumers and businesses in its current form.
Correct Answer: C

Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/05/ai-labor-market-young-tech-workers-goldman-economist.html
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the current state of deployment of artificial intelligence in production cases according to Joseph Briggs?
A. AI has been deployed in production cases.
B. AI has yet to be deployed in production cases.
C. AI has been partially deployed in production cases.
D. AI has been fully deployed in production cases.
Correct Answer: B. AI has yet to be deployed in production cases.

Q2. According to Joseph Briggs, what is the current trend of the tech sector's employment?
A. The tech sector's employment trends have been declining.
B. The tech sector's employment trends have been growing as a share of overall employment in a remarkably linear manner for the last 20 years.
C. The tech sector's employment trends have been stagnant.
D. The tech sector's employment trends have been decreasing.
Correct Answer: B. The tech sector's employment trends have been growing as a share of overall employment in a remarkably linear manner for the last 20 years.

Q3. What percentage of the work at Salesforce is handled by AI according to Marc Benioff?
A. 10% of the work at Salesforce is handled by AI.
B. 20% of the work at Salesforce is handled by AI.
C. 30% of the work at Salesforce is handled by AI.
D. 50% of the work at Salesforce is handled by AI.
Correct Answer: D. 50% of the work at Salesforce is handled by AI.

Q1. What is the main goal of the nearly five-year study on Mounjaro?
A. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 8% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
B. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 10% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
C. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 5% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
D. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 7% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the difference in the rate of death from any cause between Mounjaro and Trulicity?
A. Mounjaro has a higher rate of death from any cause than Trulicity.
B. Mounjaro has a lower rate of death from any cause than Trulicity.
C. The difference in the rate of death from any cause between Mounjaro and Trulicity is "really quite profound" and "definitely something clinically meaningful to us as clinicians."
D. The difference in the rate of death from any cause between Mounjaro and Trulicity is not significant.
Correct Answer: C

A. Approval of Mounjaro for heart health purposes and insurance coverage for patients.
B. Approval of Mounjaro for heart health purposes but no insurance coverage for patients.
C. Approval of Trulicity for heart health purposes and insurance coverage for patients.
D. Approval of Trulicity for heart health purposes but no insurance coverage for patients.
Correct Answer: A

A. Higher expenses in Medicare Advantage plans have dogged insurers over the past year as more seniors return to hospitals to undergo procedures they had delayed during the Covid-19 pandemic, such as joint and hip replacements.
B. The company expects its insurance unit's 2025 medical care ratio to come in between 89% and 89.5% due to a decrease in medical costs.
C. The company expects its insurance unit's 2025 medical care ratio to come in between 89% and 89.5% due to an increase in premiums collected.
D. The company expects its insurance unit's 2025 medical care ratio to come in between 89% and 89.5% due to a change in the company's business strategy.
Correct Answer: A. Higher expenses in Medicare Advantage plans have dogged insurers over the past year as more seniors return to hospitals to undergo procedures they had delayed during the Covid-19 pandemic, such as joint and hip replacements.

D. None of the above

Q2. What is the name of the "Make America Healthy Again" (MAHA) agenda?
A. "Make America Great Again"
B. "Make America Safe Again"
C. "Make America Healthy Again"
D. "Make America Happy Again"
Correct Answer: C

Q3. What is the purpose of the roundtable event?
A. To discuss the "Make America Healthy Again" (MAHA) agenda
B. To discuss the removal of thimerosal from shots and its link to developmental disorders
C. To discuss the vaccine skepticism of John F. Kennedy Jr.
D. To discuss the global health authorities' response to the removal of thimerosal from shots
Correct Answer: B

Link: https://abcnews.go.com/International/israels-planned-gaza-city-military-offensive-immediately-halted/story?id=124476341
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Turk's, statement about Israel's plans to occupy Gaza City?
A. This further escalation will result in more killing, more unbearable suffering, senseless destruction.
B. The Israeli government should reconsider its decision to take over Gaza City.
C. The Israeli military will take control of Gaza City under a new plan approved by the Premier's security cabinet.
D. The Israeli government must bring its occupation to an end as soon as possible.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the European Union Council President Antonio Costa's statement about Israel's plans to take over Gaza City?
A. Such an operation -- together with the continued illegal expansion of settlements in the West Bank, the massive destruction in Gaza, the blockade of humanitarian aid, and the spread of famine -- not only violates the agreement with the EU announced by the High Representative on July 19 but also undermines fundamental principles of international law and universal values.
B. The Israeli government should reconsider its decision to take over Gaza City.
C. The Israeli military will take control of Gaza City under a new plan approved by the Premier's security cabinet.
D. The Israeli government must bring its occupation to an end as soon as possible.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is Germany's response to Israel's plans to take over Gaza City?
A. The German government will suspend the exports of arms to Israel that could be used in the Gaza Strip "until further notice."

C. Gloria Mark
D. Sheryl Sandberg

A. They have a higher tendency to overuse social media and watch videos for hours on end, which can cause problems with their sleep, physical and mental health, and shorten their attention spans.
B. They have a lower tendency to overuse social media and watch videos for hours on end, which can cause problems with their sleep, physical and mental health, and shorten their attention spans.
C. They have a neutral tendency to overuse social media and watch videos for hours on end, which does not cause problems with their sleep, physical and mental health, and attention spans.
D. They have a higher tendency to overuse social media and watch videos for hours on end, which can cause problems with their sleep, physical and mental health, and attention spans.
Correct Answer: A. They have a higher tendency to overuse social media and watch videos for hours on end, which can cause problems with their sleep, physical and mental health, and shorten their attention spans.

A. Put your phone down when you've just picked it up and avoid picking it up at all.
B. Yell at your kids and expect them to police themselves.
C. Keep your phone on your person at all times.
D. Mindlessly scroll through social media.
Correct Answer: A. Put your phone down when you've just picked it up and avoid picking it up at all.

Q1. In his 1936 book, "The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money," John Maynard Keynes proposed a plan to fill old bottles with banknotes and bury them at suitable depths in disused coal mines. This plan was considered more efficient than nothing, but not the most efficient way to create jobs and keep the economy afloat. What was Keynes's plan?
A. Fill old bottles with banknotes and bury them at suitable depths in disused coal mines.
B. Create jobs and keep the economy afloat through other means.
C. Dig up the banknotes from the coal mines.
D. None of the above.
Correct Answer: A.

Q2. In the July jobs report, the American economy created an average of just 35,000 jobs per month over the last three months. This led to the firing of the director of the Bureau of Labor Statistics for reporting the bad news. What was the response of President Trump to this news?
A. Fired the director of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
B. Created more jobs.
C. Ignored the news.
D. None of the above.
Correct Answer: A.

Q3. The American economy is currently experiencing a banknote-burial scheme for the 21st century. This refers to the massive corporations known as "hyperscalers" investing in AI. What are the benefits of this investment to the rest of us?
A. Hazy at best.
B. Clear and well-defined.
C. Fantastical riches.
D. None of the above.
Correct Answer: A.

Q1. What is the German government's position on Israel's intention to occupy more of Gaza?
A. The German government supports Israel's intention to occupy more of Gaza.
B. The German government is neutral on Israel's intention to occupy more of Gaza.
C. The German government opposes Israel's intention to occupy more of Gaza.
D. The German government has not taken a position on Israel's intention to occupy more of Gaza.
Correct Answer: C. The German government opposes Israel's intention to occupy more of Gaza.

A. The German government wants to support Israel's military actions in Gaza.
B. The German government is concerned about the history of the Holocaust and Israel's survival.
C. The German government wants to maintain good relations with Israel.
D. The German government is under pressure from its center-left coalition partners to take this stance.
Correct Answer: B. The German government is concerned about the history of the Holocaust and Israel's survival.

Q3. What is the German government's position on the Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip?
A. The German government supports the Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip.
B. The German government is neutral on the Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip.
C. The German government opposes the Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip.
D. The German government has not taken a position on the Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip.
Correct Answer: C. The German government opposes the Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip.

Q1. Who was executed by Iran on Wednesday?
A. Roozbeh Vadi
B. A nuclear scientist
C. A spy for Israel
D. A key part of Iran's military chain of command
Correct Answer: C

Q2. What was Roozbeh Vadi's job at the nuclear site?
A. Access to classified information
B. Facilitating Israel's assassination of another nuclear scientist
C. Working at one of the country's most sensitive and important nuclear sites
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What did Iranian officials acknowledge publicly about Israel's actions during the war?
A. Israel's widespread infiltration of its security and intelligence apparatuses
B. Israel's ability to eliminate key parts of Iran's military chain of command
C. Israel's ability to launch drone attacks from inside Iran
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: A

Q1. Which British leader declared that his government would recognize the state of Palestine if Israel did not agree to a cease-fire with Hamas?
A. Boris Johnson
B. Theresa May
C. David Cameron
D. Michael Gove
Correct Answer: A

Q2. Which French leader invoked history in explaining why France had taken the same step as recognizing the state of Palestine a week earlier?
A. Emmanuel Macron
B. François Hollande
C. Nicolas Sarkozy
D. Jacques Chirac
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the Sykes-Picot Agreement?
A. A secret treaty between Britain and France in 1916 that carved up the Levantine territories of the crumbling Ottoman Empire into spheres of British and French control.
B. A cynical exercise in drawing borders that cut across religious, ethnic and tribal communities in what are today Israel, Lebanon, Syria and the Palestinian territories.
C. An enduring example of Western imperial arrogance.
D. A treaty that established the state of Israel.
Correct Answer: A

Q1. What did the California Supreme Court order a lower court to do?
A. Uphold the state policy that reduced how much utilities have to pay homeowners with rooftop solar panels for the energy they send to the electric grid.
B. Strike down the state policy that reduced how much utilities have to pay homeowners with rooftop solar panels for the energy they send to the electric grid.
C. Affirm the state policy that reduced how much utilities have to pay homeowners with rooftop solar panels for the energy they send to the electric grid.
D. Reconsider the state policy that reduced how much utilities have to pay homeowners with rooftop solar panels for the energy they send to the electric grid.
Correct Answer: D

Q2. What did the California Supreme Court say about the state policy that reduced how much utilities have to pay homeowners with rooftop solar panels for the energy they send to the electric grid?
A. The policy is illegal.
B. The policy is legal but the State Court of Appeal erred in affirming it without fully reviewing it and by being too deferential to state regulators.
C. The policy is legal and the State Court of Appeal did not err in affirming it.
D. The policy is illegal and the State Court of Appeal did not err in affirming it.
Correct Answer: B

Q3. What did the rooftop solar industry and its allies say about the California Supreme Court's decision?
A. They are disappointed in the decision and it will not open the door to reversing the policy that has sharply reduced the installation of solar panels on California homes over the last two years.
B. They are disappointed in the decision and it will not open the door to reversing the policy that has sharply reduced the installation of solar panels on California homes over the last two years.
C. They are happy with the decision and it could open the door to reversing the policy that has sharply reduced the installation of solar panels on California homes over the last two years.
D. They are happy with the decision and it will not open the door to reversing the policy that has sharply reduced the installation of solar panels on California homes over the last two years.
Correct Answer: C

D. The issues fall under federal and not state law.

Link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/19/books/review/empire-of-ai-karen-hao-the-optimist-keach-hagey.html
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the "paper clip problem" in the world of artificial intelligence?
A. It is a thought experiment about the dangers of pursuing objectives too literally.
B. It is a warning about the dangers of creating an artificial superintelligence.
C. It is a cautionary tale about the dangers of common-sense limits.
D. It is a story about the dangers of pursuing an artificial superintelligence.
Correct Answer: A.

Q2. What is the "modern-day colonial world order" in the context of the article?
A. It refers to the European powers of the 18th and 19th centuries.
B. It refers to the tech companies of Silicon Valley.
C. It refers to the countries of Kenya, Colombia, and Chile.
D. It refers to the pursuit of an artificial superintelligence.
Correct Answer: A.

Q3. What is the main argument of "Empire of AI"?
A. The pursuit of an artificial superintelligence is a dangerous and unethical pursuit.
B. The pursuit of an artificial superintelligence is a necessary and ethical pursuit.
C. The pursuit of an artificial superintelligence is a dangerous and unethical pursuit, but the paper clip problem is a cautionary tale about the dangers of common-sense limits.
D. The pursuit of an artificial superintelligence is a necessary and ethical pursuit, and the paper clip problem is a cautionary tale about the dangers of pursuing objectives too literally.
Correct Answer: A.

B. 39%

D. 45%

B. To discuss the possibility of Switzerland leaving the European Union
C. To discuss the possibility of a trade agreement between Switzerland and the United States
D. To discuss the possibility of a trade agreement between Switzerland and the European Union

B. It will have a minor impact on Swiss businesses
C. It will have a major impact on Swiss businesses
D. It will have a devastating impact on Swiss businesses
Correct Answer: C

Q1. Which radioactive contamination was found in the wasp nests at the Savannah River Site?
A. High levels of radioactive contamination
B. Very low levels of radioactive contamination
C. No radioactive contamination
D. Moderate levels of radioactive contamination
Correct Answer: B. Very low levels of radioactive contamination

Q2. What is the purpose of the Department of Energy's management of the discovery of the wasp nests at the Savannah River Site?
A. To protect SRS workers from health risks
B. To protect the community and environment from health risks
C. To study the extent of the environmental contamination at the site
D. To study the organisms and ecosystems in radioactive regions of the world
Correct Answer: C. To study the extent of the environmental contamination at the site

Q3. What is the significance of the discovery of the wasp nests with very low levels of radioactive contamination at the Savannah River Site?
A. It raises questions about the extent of the environmental contamination at the site
B. It poses a health risk to SRS workers, the community, or the environment
C. It is not significant because it does not affect the health or safety of anyone
D. It is significant because it shows the effectiveness of the Department of Energy's management of the site
Correct Answer: A. It raises questions about the extent of the environmental contamination at the site

Q1. What is the legal and scientific basis for regulating greenhouse gases in the United States?
A. The Supreme Court ruled in a case called Massachusetts versus EPA that greenhouse gases are not pollutants and the EPA cannot regulate them.
B. The IPCC established the most comprehensive set of information to date on establishing that climate change is caused by human activities and the dangers that it poses.
C. The Obama administration determined that climate change and the emissions that are furthering climate change do not cause a danger to human health and welfare.
D. The EPA is making a series of arguments and alternative arguments, what one legal scholar described as throwing a bunch of spaghetti to see what sticks with a court.
Correct Answer: B

Q2. What is the Obama administration's decision on regulating emissions from power plants in the United States?
A. The Obama administration made the decision that it was not a legal fight that it could win and it wasn't a science fight that they felt they could win.
B. The Obama administration determined that climate change and the emissions that are furthering climate change cause a danger to human health and welfare.
C. The Obama administration decided to repeal the endangerment finding.
D. The Obama administration made the decision to reduce methane from leaks from oil and gas wells.
Correct Answer: A

A. The business community was so worried about the endangerment finding that they lobbied heavily against it.
B. The business community had lost an appetite for fighting the endangerment finding by 2016.
C. The business community was in favor of the endangerment finding and supported it.
D. The business community was neutral on the endangerment finding and did not take a position on it.
Correct Answer: B

D. To learn how to pilot a Falcon 9 rocket
Correct Answer: A

B. India

D. United States

Correct Answer: B. The project was abandoned due to community opposition.

Q3. What is the main concern of the community in Mooresville regarding the data center project?
A. The project will overtax the electric grid.
B. The project will pollute the water and air.
C. The project will disrupt the rural peace with hulking structures emitting a high-tech hum.
D. The project will not provide enough jobs for the local community.
Correct Answer: C. The project will disrupt the rural peace with hulking structures emitting a high-tech hum.

B. Petlibro's water fountain has a 2.1-gallon capacity, and between Mabel and my two cats drinking out of it, I refill it every few days by pouring water directly into the serving tray.
C. PupFlask's dishwasher-safe dog water bottle comes in two sizes (27 and 40 ounces) and it's composed of two parts: a stainless steel bottle that stores water and a silicone lid that folds into a drinking bowl.

C. The CPUC’s decision to slash rooftop solar incentives could not be challenged.

B. Vladimir Putin
C. Steve Witkoff
D. Donald Trump
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the purpose of the diplomatic efforts aimed at ending the war in Ukraine?
A. To gain support for a potential ceasefire from the Ukrainian government and European leaders
B. To meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska
C. To make a Putin meeting with Zelenskyy a condition for a meeting between Trump and the Russian president to take place
D. To impose new sanctions on Russia if they do not agree to a ceasefire
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What did President Trump say about the territories that would be swapped between Russia and Ukraine in a potential ceasefire?
A. There would be no swapping of territories
B. The swapping of territories would be to the betterment of both Russia and Ukraine
C. The swapping of territories would only be to the betterment of Russia
D. The swapping of territories would only be to the betterment of Ukraine
Correct Answer: B

D. Wake Island

C. To harm the cultural, spiritual, religious, subsistence, educational, recreational, and aesthetic interests of Native Hawaiian plaintiffs
D. To destroy the area
Correct Answer: A

D. The Trump administration's rollback of federal ocean protections is upheld

Q1. Which European officials presented a counterproposal to the United States on Saturday regarding the Ukraine conflict?
A. French President Emmanuel Macron
B. British Prime Minister Keir Starmer
C. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz
D. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen
Correct Answer: B. British Prime Minister Keir Starmer

Q2. What was the main demand of the European counterproposal regarding the Ukraine conflict?
A. A ceasefire must take place before any other steps are taken
B. Any territory exchange must be reciprocal, with firm security guarantees
C. Ukraine must cede land to Russia
D. Russia must withdraw its troops from Ukraine
Correct Answer: A. A ceasefire must take place before any other steps are taken

A. Ukraine should cede land to Russia
B. The United States will not provide any further aid to Ukraine
C. The path to peace for Ukraine should be determined together and only together with Ukraine
D. The United States will impose economic sanctions on Russia
Correct Answer: C. The path to peace for Ukraine should be determined together and only together with Ukraine

A. Christ Church in Idaho
B. Congregation of Reformed Evangelical Churches
C. The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
D. The Catholic Church
Correct Answer: B. Congregation of Reformed Evangelical Churches

Q2. What does Doug Wilson, senior pastor of Christ Church in Idaho, believe about women's role in society?
A. Women should be allowed to vote and serve in combat roles
B. Women are the chief executives of the home and entrusted with eternal souls
C. Women should not be allowed to vote and serve in combat roles
D. Women should be equal to men in all aspects of society
Correct Answer: B. Women are the chief executives of the home and entrusted with eternal souls

Q3. What is the goal of the followers of Doug Wilson and his church?
A. To spread the idea that women should be allowed to vote and serve in combat roles
B. To spread the idea that women are the chief executives of the home and entrusted with eternal souls
C. To make the idea that women should not be allowed to vote and serve in combat roles enforceable
D. To make the idea that slavery really isn't all that bad enforceable
Correct Answer: C. To make the idea that women should not be allowed to vote and serve in combat roles enforceable

D. Russia demands Ukraine to recognize Russian as an official language on par with Ukrainian.

C. Ukraine believes time is on its side as the exhausted and outgunned Ukrainian forces are struggling to stem Russian advances in many sectors of the over 1,000-kilometer (over 600-mile) front line while swarms of Russian missiles and drones batter Ukrainian cities.

Correct Answer: A

C. The huge influx of border-crossers starting with the COVID-19 pandemic, at the end of the first Trump administration and during the Biden administration, made it difficult to keep up with the number of asylum-seekers who need credible fear interviews.

A. They are marked for "expedited removal" when they first entered the country.

C. They are detained by ICE while they fight their cases.
D. They are allowed to go to court, work, or apply for asylum without detention.
Correct Answer: C

================================================================================
Q1. In what year was Jane Jacobs' landmark book "The Death and Life of Great American Cities" published?
A. 1951
B. 1961
C. 1971
D. 1981
Correct Answer: B. 1961

Q2. What is the current view of Los Angeles among urban experts residing in denser cities?
A. It is seen as a cautionary tale of unsustainable resource planning and structurally poor governance systems.
B. It is seen as a global pioneer in rethinking the curb.
C. It is seen as a toxic mixture of unsustainable resource planning and structurally poor governance systems.
D. It is seen as a smoggy expanse of subdivisions and spaghetti junctions.
Correct Answer: C. It is seen as a toxic mixture of unsustainable resource planning and structurally poor governance systems.

Q3. What is the current view of Los Angeles' curb among urban experts residing in denser cities?
A. It is seen as an afterthought.
B. It is seen as a charging node.
C. It is seen as a logistics port.
D. It is seen as a civic gathering point.
Correct Answer: D. It is seen as a civic gathering point.

Link: https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/8/10/un-report-says-its-female-staff-in-afghanistan-have-received-death-threats?traffic_source=rss

================================================================================
Q1. What is the UN report's finding about the Taliban government's treatment of girls' education in Afghanistan?
A. The Taliban government has "deliberately deprived" at least 1.4 million girls of their right to an education.
B. The Taliban government has "deliberately deprived" at least 1.4 million boys of their right to an education.
C. The Taliban government has "deliberately deprived" at least 1.4 million children of their right to an education.
D. The Taliban government has "deliberately deprived" at least 1.4 million families of their right to an education.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the UN report's finding about the Taliban government's treatment of women's personal freedoms and safety in Afghanistan?
A. The Taliban government has imposed certain rules and prohibitions on the population as a whole, but has not specifically targeted women and girls.
B. The Taliban government has imposed certain rules and prohibitions on the population as a whole, but has specifically targeted girls and women by reason of their gender, depriving them of fundamental rights and freedoms.
C. The Taliban government has imposed certain rules and prohibitions on the population as a whole, but has specifically targeted boys and men by reason of their gender, depriving them of fundamental rights and freedoms.
D. The Taliban government has imposed certain rules and prohibitions on the population as a whole, but has not targeted any specific group based on gender.
Correct Answer: B

Q3. What is the ICC's finding about the Taliban leaders' abuses against women and girls in Afghanistan?
A. The ICC has found that the Taliban leaders' abuses against women and girls were baseless rhetoric.
B. The ICC has found that the Taliban leaders' abuses against women and girls were justified by the Taliban government's authority.
C. The ICC has found that the Taliban leaders' abuses against women and girls were not related to their gender.
D. The ICC has found that the Taliban leaders' abuses against women and girls were specific to the population as a whole and not

================================================================================
Q1. What is the primary cause of pain from bee and wasp stings?
A. Immune response to urushiol
B. Direct contact with urushiol
C. The substance itself
D. Mechanical pressure from the sting
Correct Answer: C. The substance itself

Q2. What is the risk of developing a rash from poison ivy if urushiol is on your clothing or a pet’s fur and your skin later brushes against it?
A. No risk at all
B. The same risk as directly touching the plant
C. No risk if the skin doesn’t brush against the urushiol
D. The risk is higher than directly touching the plant
Correct Answer: B. The same risk as directly touching the plant

Q3. What is the risk of getting stung multiple times at once from bees or wasps?
A. No risk at all
B. The risk is higher than getting stung once
C. The risk is the same as getting stung once
D. The risk is lower than getting stung once
Correct Answer: B. The risk is higher than getting stung once

Q1. Which tick species is capable of causing alpha-gal syndrome?
A. Black-legged tick
B. Lyme disease
C. Deer tick
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: C

C. Take medication to relieve symptoms.
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: A

C. By transmitting Lyme disease.
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: B

================================================================================
Q1. What is the Israeli Prime Minister's plan to deal with Gaza City?
A. Israel plans to establish a "non-Israeli peaceful civil administration" in Gaza.
B. Israel plans to take control of the entire Gaza Strip.
C. Israel plans to seize control of Gaza City and the remaining sliver of Gaza not already under Israeli control.
D. Israel plans to establish a "non-Israeli peaceful civil administration" in Gaza and take control of the entire Gaza Strip.
Correct Answer: C. Israel plans to seize control of Gaza City and the remaining sliver of Gaza not already under Israeli control.

Q2. What is the Israeli Prime Minister's long-term plan for the future of Gaza?
A. Israel plans to establish a "non-Israeli peaceful civil administration" in Gaza.
B. Israel plans to take control of the entire Gaza Strip.
C. Israel plans to seize control of Gaza City and the remaining sliver of Gaza not already under Israeli control.
D. Israel plans to establish a "non-Israeli peaceful civil administration" in Gaza and take control of the entire Gaza Strip.
Correct Answer: D. Israel plans to establish a "non-Israeli peaceful civil administration" in Gaza and take control of the entire Gaza Strip.

Q3. What is the Israeli Prime Minister's plan to deal with the hostages held in Gaza?
A. Israel plans to strike a ceasefire deal with Hamas that frees the hostages.
B. Israel plans to seize control of Gaza City and the remaining sliver of Gaza not already under Israeli control.
C. Israel plans to establish a "non-Israeli peaceful civil administration" in Gaza.
D. Israel plans to take control of the entire Gaza Strip.
Correct Answer: A. Israel plans to strike a ceasefire deal with Hamas that frees the hostages.

D. It was banned for sale to both U.S. and Chinese customers.

B. Chancellor Angela Merkel and President Emmanuel Macron
C. Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Prime Minister Keir Starmer
D. Chancellor Angela Merkel and Prime Minister Keir Starmer

D. Not comment on a Palestinian state at the United Nations in late September

C. They are indifferent to the assassinations.

Correct Answer: C. Spain

D. National Birthrate Regulations

C. Amnesty for Undocumented Immigrants
D. National Birthrate Regulations
Correct Answer: C. Amnesty for Undocumented Immigrants

Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/11/us-china-truce-extension-hangs-in-the-balance-as-deadline-looms-.html
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What was the outcome of the latest bilateral meeting between the US and China in Stockholm in July 2024?
A. The two sides agreed to extend the tariff truce by another 90 days.
B. The two sides reached a lasting deal to end the trade war.
C. The two sides decided to impose new tariffs on each other.
D. The two sides failed to reach an agreement and increased tariffs on each other.
Correct Answer: A. The two sides agreed to extend the tariff truce by another 90 days.

Q2. What was the impact of the tariff truce on trade between the US and China in May 2024?
A. Trade volumes between the two countries increased by 36.2%, 10.4%, and 18.4% in May, June, and July, respectively.
B. The prohibitive 145% tariff was reduced in April, allowing room for further negotiation.
C. The blanket 40% tariff on goods routed through third-party countries was imposed, slowing down exports.
D. The tariff truce had no impact on trade between the two countries.
Correct Answer: B. The prohibitive 145% tariff was reduced in April, allowing room for further negotiation.

Q3. What was the impact of the tariff truce on China's exports in June and July 2024?
A. China's rare-earth exports globally surged 60% to 7,742 metric tons in June, highest since January 2012, and dropped to 5,994.3 metric tons in July.
B. China's soybean imports volumes grew 36.2%, 10.4%, and 18.4% in May, June, and July, respectively.
C. The blanket 40% tariff on goods routed through third-party countries slowed down China's exports.
D. The tariff truce had no impact on China's exports.
Correct Answer: C. The blanket 40% tariff on goods routed through third-party countries slowed down China's exports

Link: https://www.msnbc.com/deadline-white-house/deadline-legal-blog/ghislaine-maxwell-grand-jury-transcript-judge-denied-unseal-rcna224275
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What was the premise behind the Trump Justice Department's motion to unseal grand jury transcripts and exhibits in Ghislaine Maxwell's case?
A. The grand jury details would shed new light on Jeffrey Epstein's and Maxwell's crimes or on the government's investigation into them.
B. The grand jury materials presented to the Maxwell grand jury "do not contribute anything to public knowledge" and were aimed at diverting attention from the case.
C. The evidence presented to the Maxwell grand jury was a matter of public record.
D. The grand jury materials presented to the Maxwell grand jury identified any person other than Epstein and Maxwell as having had sexual contact with a minor.
Correct Answer: B. The grand jury materials presented to the Maxwell grand jury "do not contribute anything to public knowledge" and were aimed at diverting attention from the case.

Q2. What was the outcome of the Trump Justice Department's motion to unseal grand jury transcripts and exhibits in Ghislaine Maxwell's case?
A. The motion was granted and the grand jury details were released to the public.
B. The motion was denied and the grand jury details remained sealed.
C. The judge ordered the grand jury details to be released to the public with redactions.
D. The judge ordered the grand jury details to be released to the public in their entirety.
Correct Answer: B. The motion was denied and the grand jury details remained sealed.

Q3. What was the purpose of the Maxwell grand jury?
A. To return an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
B. To investigate the crimes of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
C. To hear testimony from firsthand witnesses, victims, and others related to the crimes of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
D. To expose the disingenuousness behind the government's claim that unsealing would be revelatory.
Correct Answer: D. To expose the disingenuousness behind the government's claim that unsealing would be revelatory.

Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the author's opinion on recovery after a disaster?
A. Recovery is always rebuilding.
B. Recovery is not rebuilding.
C. Recovery is fair.
D. Recovery is unfair.
Correct Answer: B. Recovery is not rebuilding.

Q2. What is the author's opinion on the role of privileged groups in disaster recovery?
A. Privileged groups should not be involved in disaster recovery.
B. Privileged groups should be involved in disaster recovery.
C. Privileged groups should be excluded from disaster recovery.
D. Privileged groups should not be excluded from disaster recovery.
Correct Answer: D. Privileged groups should not be excluded from disaster recovery.

Q3. What is the author's opinion on the role of outside groups in disaster recovery?
A. Outside groups should be excluded from disaster recovery.
B. Outside groups should be involved in disaster recovery.
C. Outside groups should not be involved in disaster recovery.
D. Outside groups should not be excluded from disaster recovery.
Correct Answer: A. Outside groups should be excluded from disaster recovery.

C. $5,000
D. $2,000

Q1. What is the expected outcome of President Trump's meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin this week?
A. A deal will be made to halt the war in Ukraine.
B. It is not possible to work out a deal to halt the war in Ukraine.
C. The meeting will be a feel-out meeting to determine if a deal can be made.
D. The meeting will be a press conference to announce plans for a federal takeover of Washington's police force.
Correct Answer: C. The meeting will be a feel-out meeting to determine if a deal can be made.

Q2. What is President Trump's stance on the involvement of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in discussions with Russian leader Vladimir Putin?
A. He is essential to any effort to seek peace.
B. He is not necessary for any discussions with Putin.
C. He is a dictator because his country has not held elections during the war.
D. He is not mentioned in the article.
Correct Answer: B. He is not necessary for any discussions with Putin.

Q3. What is the long-term aim of Russia in its relations with Ukraine?
A. To return it to Moscow's sphere of influence.
B. To keep all the territory its forces now occupy.
C. To prevent Ukraine from joining NATO.
D. To work out a deal to halt the war in Ukraine.
Correct Answer: A. To return it to Moscow's sphere of influence.

Link: https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cq877llq099o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
Info: BBC News Article (cq877llq099o)
================================================================================
Q1. Which marine heatwave caused the worst bleaching on record for Western Australia's coral reefs?
A. 2022-23
B. 2023-24
C. 2024-25
D. 2025-26
Correct Answer: C. 2024-25

Q2. What was the effect of the heat stress on the coral during the 2024-25 bleaching season?
A. The coral expelled the algae which gives them life and colour, causing them to bleach.
B. The coral did not expel the algae which gives them life and colour, causing them to bleach.
C. The coral did not experience heat stress during the 2024-25 bleaching season.
D. The coral experienced no significant heat stress during the 2024-25 bleaching season.
Correct Answer: A. The coral expelled the algae which gives them life and colour, causing them to bleach.

Q3. Which research institute conducted the study on the 2024-25 bleaching season for Western Australia's coral reefs?
A. Australian Institute of Marine Science (Aims)
B. Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority
C. Bureau of Meteorology
D. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
Correct Answer: A. Australian Institute of Marine Science (Aims)

D. They were not used in any photo shoot

Q1. What specific action did Trump announce to rescue the capital from crime and bloodshed?
A. He placed the DC Metropolitan and Police Department under direct federal control.
B. He deployed the National Guard to enforce local laws.
C. He increased funding for prosecutors.
D. He created a new police force.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What was the reason for Trump's decision to place the DC Metropolitan and Police Department under direct federal control?
A. The rising violence in the capital now urgently endangers public servants, citizens, and tourists.
B. The city's police force was not performing well.
C. The city's police force was under investigation.
D. The city's police force was involved in a scandal.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What was the trigger for Trump's decision to take Federal control of the city?
A. An assault involving Edward Coristine.
B. A shooting at the White House.
C. A bombing at the Capitol.
D. A natural disaster in the city.
Correct Answer: A
